messages: def8c8318057090051923f400a8ef389 (02:00): +I am struggling with Server Side Includes. I know that a SSI must have the extension .shtml and I have configured Apache for this. Problem is: my pages need to have the .shtml extension to be able to include .shtml files. Is this correct ? Example: My index page gets its header from header.shtml. But if the filename is not index.shtml, the SSI fields are blank !
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (02:00): +ssi howto is http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/howto/ssi.html
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:00): +ACTION points BobbyGrace at that url
def8c8318057090051923f400a8ef389 (02:01): +tried that. have read it several times
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (02:03): +xbithack is http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/mod/mod_include.html#xbithack or http://httpd.apache.org/docs/mod/mod_include.html#xbithack
def8c8318057090051923f400a8ef389 (02:03): +cannot use bithack
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:03): +You want ssi to be interpreted for .html files?
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:04): +BobbyGrace: you want to change the SSI to interpret .ht... what noodl said
def8c8318057090051923f400a8ef389 (02:04): +My website is hosted on some other host, but I need a developmentserver that need to be a "clone" of the real server
def8c8318057090051923f400a8ef389 (02:04): +_Lewellyn: no, I dont think so. But should the SSI directives be ignored in a normal .html or .php page ?
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:05): +Does your external server interpret ssi for .html files?
def8c8318057090051923f400a8ef389 (02:05): +I thought it was the requested content that had to have the .shtml extension
def8c8318057090051923f400a8ef389 (02:05): +noodl: no. just .shtml
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:05): +Ok, now I'm confused. What's the problem with naming your files as .shtml then?
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:06): +And besides, I don't think ssi interprets files <!--#include-d

def8c8318057090051923f400a8ef389 (02:07): +Me confused too ! To make it clear: INDEX.HTML contains a directive to HEADER.SHTML . but the area where the contents of HEADER.SHTML should be is blank ( it is ignored ) . But if I rename INDEX.HTML to INDEX.SHTML, the directive is successful, and HEADER.SHTML shows in INDEX.SHTML. But I though that regular .HTML pages and .PHP pages could have there redirectives
def8c8318057090051923f400a8ef389 (02:08): +noodl:  the problem is: If I want a PHP page that must contain a directive to an SHTML page
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:08): +'there redirectives'?
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:09): +You wan't the output of your php file to be parsed for ssi directives?

def8c8318057090051923f400a8ef389 (02:11): +noodl: If we are understandig eachother correct: Yes. Example : I want index.php to contain this line : <!--#echo var="DATE_LOCAL"--> . and the page will show a date, not a blank field
def8c8318057090051923f400a8ef389 (02:12): +is this impossible to do with ServerSideIncludes ?
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:12): +in this case, replicating your host will require a LOT of assumptions...
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:12): +That's possible but pointless and takes a specialised config that your external host probably doesn't provide. Why not just do date parsing with php?

def8c8318057090051923f400a8ef389 (02:13): +_Lewellyn: Yes, but I only take basic assumptions. I have configured my apache server to handle documents according to the instructions provided by my host provider
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:14): +so far, if your documents work on their server, you need to parse at least .shtml, .html, and .php for SSI
def8c8318057090051923f400a8ef389 (02:14): +noodl: So in index.php it is impossible to show the contents of header.shtml this way ? : <!--#include file="includes/header.shtml"-->
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:14): +and parsing .php for SSI seems silly
c6fd7ed5d677ac28ac6fa7696a56faf5 (02:14): +so if you move hosts you will have to edit all your files for the date instead of just using something native in php?
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:15): +and each filetype you parse slows things down that much more
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:15): +you're SURE your host doesn't use the xbithack?
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:15): +Perhaps it would help for you to tell the problem you need to solve, rather then how you're planning to solve it.

def8c8318057090051923f400a8ef389 (02:17): +SourceForge.net project web servers will apply SSI to files ending in the .shtml file extension. The executable permissions bit has no impact on our SSI handling; SSI files must have a .shtml extension.
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (02:18): +ok, I parse html files,
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (02:18): +you want php parsed, yes or no?
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:18): +BobbyGrace: afaik, SF.net *only* parses .shtml
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:18): +so what you want isn't possible
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (02:19): +barefoot gave me a solution to use htaccess to parse html

def8c8318057090051923f400a8ef389 (02:19): +noodl: Yes certainly. This is maybe stupid, i dont know, cause i dont have much experience in webdeveloping. I want to use SSI to make frames. then I would just include the header and menu into each document
def8c8318057090051923f400a8ef389 (02:20): +because, after what I have experienced, frameset is devil-in-person
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:20): +Ok, that's easy enough. Where does php come in to it?

def8c8318057090051923f400a8ef389 (02:21): +noodl: I want some functionality that might require php. I dont want to develop the site, and then find out I have to drop one thing in order to get another one working
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:21): +Then, if you can, use php from the start.
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:21): +ssi is very limitted.
def8c8318057090051923f400a8ef389 (02:22): +In other words: the technoques I use, must be PHP compatible. After what I have understood now I cannot use SSI for redirectives
def8c8318057090051923f400a8ef389 (02:22): +BRB, will probably be back later with more dumb question :)
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:22): +'redirectives' doesn't mean anything.
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (02:22): +can you put .htaccess files in and have them affect your directories?
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:22): +SSI is fairly unuseful for the average user these days

eb9279982226a42afdf2860dbdc29b45 (02:27): -Hi all, I could really use some mod_rewrite help (apache 1). I'm trying to write a rule that redirects users that go to /search or /search/index.html to search.foo.com *unless* they arrive there with a query string. If they have a querystring they should not be redirected and stay at /search/index.html.
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:30): +jaga: http://pastebin.ca/67989
eb9279982226a42afdf2860dbdc29b45 (02:31): -noodl: thank you very much.
c4a5cea447ab51a669bdecbda8f1e178 (02:31): +should start a mod_rewite channel..
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:32): +Don't thank me 'till you've tried it. I might just eat all your cheese!
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (02:32): +noodl: you know how ot make a htaccess file that would route a subdomain.domain.com to a certain folder ?
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:32): +tempered: Yes, but it's generally a bad idea.

18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (02:33): +I want them to hit http://foo.domain.com and go to /home/tempered/domain.com/foo/ and the whole while make it appear as though it is http://foo.domain.com not http://domain.com/foo
c6fd7ed5d677ac28ac6fa7696a56faf5 (02:33): +why dont you just move foo out of the doc root?
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:34): +Because that's what virtual hosts are for. Doing this with mod_rewrite in .htaccess is slow and liable to cause brain ache.
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (02:34): +I want it in doc root so that there is a logical heirarchy, and so that one .htaccess file can control all of domain.com + whatever foo's I put in

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (02:35): +htaccess files apply to the directory in which they are placed, and to all subdirectories thereof. or Only needed if you don't have access to the main server config. or http://httpd.apache.org/docs/howto/htaccess.html or http://httpd.apache.org/docs/configuring.html#htaccess or

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (02:35): +..http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/howto/htaccess.html or if it doesn't work, check fajita's AllowOverride directives in httpd.conf or a possible performance hit or disabled with AllowOverride None
c6fd7ed5d677ac28ac6fa7696a56faf5 (02:35): +but foo is a subdomain
c3a1fa1c49c083817f4c74878181d845 (02:35): +"Only needed if you don't have access to the main server config."
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (02:35): +Also I'm forced to use a http panel, which means that every time I create a subdomain it takes several minutes, I don't have access to main httpd.conf
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (02:35): +the setup is for search engines
c6fd7ed5d677ac28ac6fa7696a56faf5 (02:36): +you dont have access but that pannel does
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (02:37): +yes but I need to make one for each state ( so 50 subdomains ) and, it takes several minutes plus it times out all the time for each one I create
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (02:37): +was trying to save several hours of monotony
c6fd7ed5d677ac28ac6fa7696a56faf5 (02:37): +you have 50 subdmains and dont bother to lease your own server?
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:37): +Then get rid of your control panel.
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (02:38): +I ended up writing a program to sit in front of the computer and do the task for me but if there is an .htaccess way I was going to try it
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (02:38): +can't get rid of it, it's only way to speak to the server that thy've given me
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (02:38): +why do I have to justify for that answer lol?
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (02:38): +Does your control panel allow you to edit a fragment of httpd.conf directky?
3da838af290dda1832fd04e9daa837fa (02:39): +how can i enable curl for apache ?
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (02:39): +no, it just appends stuff
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (02:39): +I wanted to cut and paste a config for all of the subs, but I couldn't
c6fd7ed5d677ac28ac6fa7696a56faf5 (02:39): +there is no way I would do what youre doing with 50 domains to handle.
18068d7935111ab2b67991d05c04808d (02:39): +you mean, no way you'd do .htaccess?
c6fd7ed5d677ac28ac6fa7696a56faf5 (02:40): +no way I would use some cut rate host
c6fd7ed5d677ac28ac6fa7696a56faf5 (02:40): +50 doamins is to much trouble to not have root on the box

c6fd7ed5d677ac28ac6fa7696a56faf5 (02:40): +for 100 a month you can get a decent setup from serverbeach
